treatment.etymology: [Sequoia, generic name of coast redwood, and Greek dendros, tree]
treatment.description: Trees giant, evergreen. Branchlets terete. Leaves alternate, radiating. Adult leaves mostly needlelike, triangular in cross section, somewhat divergent to strongly appressed; abaxial glands absent. Pollen cones with 12--20 sporophylls, each sporophyll with 2--5 pollen sacs. Seed cones maturing and opening in 2 years, persistent to 20 years, oblong; scales persistent, 25--45, valvate, Â± peltate, thick and woody. Seeds 3--9 per scale, lenticular, subequally 2-winged; cotyledons (3--)4(--6). x = 11.
